data.title: Get Current Census Data for Villa Rica, GA
data.meta_description: Need Villa Rica demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Villa Rica, GA from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 18,703 people, Villa Rica is the 66th most populated city in the state of Georgia out of 667 cities. But watch out, Villa Rica, because Thomasville with 18,558 people and Richmond Hill with 18,459 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Villa Rica racial/ethnic groups are Black (44.1%) followed by White (39.5%) and Hispanic (8.4%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Villa Rica households was $82,373. Villa Rica households made slightly more than Bemiss households ($82,134) and Grantville households ($81,815) . However, 5.5% of Villa Rica families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Villa Rica residents is 34.0 years young.
